title: Pete Davidson ISIS terrorist who thanks Trump on Saturday Night Live
text:
Pete Davidson was part of a bizarre sketch on Saturday Night Live (Picture: NBC) Pete Davidson played a terrorist in a bizarre Saturday Night Live sketch that once again featured Alec Baldwin’s iconic impression of President Donald Trump.

The cold open addressed Trump’s decision to withdraw troops from Syria, and the comedian and actor played a recently-freed member of ISIS.

Appearing next to Trump at a fictional rally in New Mexico, he thanked the president for ‘bringing back jobs for terrorists’.

Trump brought him up on stage and asked where he is from. ‘ISIS’, Davidson replied.

‘I was a prisoner in Syria until last week when you freed me, so I just wanted to say, thank you for bringing jobs back to ISIS. I promise that I will make ISIS great again!’

The president says: ‘Terrific. What that great guy. ISIS is back in a big, big way, folks. And we love that, don’t we?’

Also in the sketch was Kate McKinnon, playing Lindsey Graham, a political ally of Trump.

Alex Moffat as Mark Zuckerberg (Picture: NBC) ‘I’m sweating profusely all the time. Even my bodily fluids are trying to distance themselves from me,’ she joked in character.

Trump then turned his attention to Mark Zuckerberg following his appearance before congress this week to discuss Facebook’s cryptocurrency plans.

SNL star Alex Moffat then appeared as Zuckerberg, joking that he was trying to come across as less robotic.

He said in a stilted voice: ‘Hello. Project. Eye contact. Friendly laugh. Ha.’

The president went on to thank him for ‘running his Russia campaign’. Ha.

Meanwhile it was recently announced that Eddie Murphy will be returning to Saturday Night Live for the first time in 35 years.

It comes amid reports he is going to release a Netflix stand-up special in the coming months, while he also has a lead role in the comedy biopic Dolemite Is My Name.
